tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Fundamental Data API
tool_list.tool description:
Simple access to fundamental data API for stocks, ETFs, Mutual Funds, and Indices from different exchanges and countries. Almost all major US, UK, EU, India, and Asia exchanges.

Stocks, ETFs, Mutual Funds fundamental data

Major US companies supported from 1985, more than 30 years and non-US symbols supported from 2000, it’s more than 21 years of the financial data. Symbols from major US exchanges (around 11000 tickers in total from NYSE, NASDAQ, and ARCA) 20 years both yearly and quarterly. For minor companies, we have data for the last 6 years and the previous 20 quarters. And the data is continually growing.
We support more than 20.000 US Funds. Our database has equity funds as well as balanced and bond-based mutual funds.
We also support details for more than 10,000 ETFs from different exchanges and countries.
We provide Index Constituents (or Index Components) data for all major indices all around the world.
Please note, not all companies report the whole financial data, then we can not guarantee that each company will have all data endpoints we do support.
Due to a very complex data structure, we support fundamental data feeds only in JSON format.

tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Insider Transactions API
tool_list.tool description:
The insider transactions API data is available for all US companies that report Form 4 to SEC. Insider trading involves trading in a public company’s stock by someone who has non-public, material information about that stock for any reason. In some cases, insider transactions could be very useful for making investment decisions.

The Insider Transactions Data API is a part of Fundamental API and accessible under Fundamental subscription. Each Insider Transactions API request consumes 1 API call.
Moving Average(MA) is used to smooth out price fluctuations and get rid of market noise.
On Balance Volume(OBV) is a momentum indicator, which uses volume flow to forecast upcoming price changes.
Time Series Forecast(TSF) calculates trend based on the last points of multiple regression trendlines.

tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Macroeconomics Data and Macro Indicators API
tool_list.tool description:
Macroeconomics is a part of economics dealing with the performance, structure, behavior, and decision-making of an economy as a whole. Our Macroeconomics Data API includes regional, national, and global economies. We provide the data for more than 30 macro indicators such as GDP, unemployment rates, national income, price indices, inflation rates, consumption, international trades, and many other significant indicators.

The Macroeconomics Data API is a part of Fundamental API and accessible under Fundamental subscription. Each Macroeconomics API request consumes 1 API call. To get macroeconomics indicators use the following URL:

> https://eodhistoricaldata.com/api/macro-indicator/COUNTRY?api_token=YOUR_API_TOKEN&fmt=json&indicator=inflation_consumer_prices_annual

**COUNTRY**: String. REQUIRED. Defines the country for which the indicator will be shown. The country should be defined in the Alpha-3 ISO format. Possible values: USA, FRA, DEU…
**api_ token**: String. REQUIRED. Your api_token to access the API. You will get it after registration.
**indicator**: String. OPTIONAL. Defines which macroeconomics data indicator will be shown. See the list of possible indicators below. The default value is ‘gdp_current_usd‘.
**fmt**: String. OPTIONAL. The output format could be ‘json’ for JSON and ‘csv’ for CSV output. The default value is ‘json’.

task_description: This task assesses the overall mood or sentiment surrounding a particular stock by combining quantitative analysis of news media with real-time data from social platforms dedicated to trading and investing.

query: I'd like to get a comprehensive view of all the social market chatter that might impact my investment decisions right now. Can you gather recent discussions from people I follow, check if anyone has mentioned me in conversations, show me what MarketPro is saying, pull updates on stocks in my watchlist #54321, include official investor relations announcements, and also check my private messages for any trading tips? I'm especially interested in seeing if there are any chart patterns being shared in my home feed.

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves the most recent 30 messages from the authenticating user's home stream, which aggregates content from followed users and stocks. This endpoint leverages StockTwits' social communications platform—built on a market-focused social graph—to deliver real-time updates and insights, enabling users to stay informed about trending discussions and stock-related conversations relevant to their interests.

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves the most recent 30 messages for a specified user, including the user object in the response. This endpoint is part of StockTwits, a social communications platform and social graph for market investors, which leverages real-time market data and user-generated content to enable discussion and analysis of financial markets. The tool provides direct access to user interaction history, supporting use cases like tracking conversations or analyzing engagement patterns within the investing community.

This endpoint retrieves the most recent 30 messages for the authenticating user's private watch list of symbols, enabling real-time tracking of market discussions. StockTwits, a social communications platform and social graph for investors, aggregates these messages to facilitate community-driven insights, allowing users to monitor symbols they follow and engage with shared interests across its network.

Retrieves the most recent 30 messages from verified Investor Relations users on StockTwits, leveraging the platform's social communications infrastructure to surface real-time market sentiment and investor insights. This endpoint utilizes StockTwits' social graph and financial data integration capabilities—designed for investors and market participants—to provide actionable intelligence from curated corporate communication channels.

task_description: This task assesses the overall mood or sentiment surrounding a particular stock by combining quantitative analysis of news media with real-time data from social platforms dedicated to trading and investing.

query: I'm interested in understanding NVIDIA's recent volatility patterns. Could you analyze hourly trading data to show how NVIDIA stock's directional movement, trading range, and adaptive moving average trends compare to current cryptocurrency market conditions? I want to see if there's any correlation between NVIDIA's technical indicators and the broader crypto market.

tool_list.tool description: Calculates the Minus Directional Movement (MINUS_DM) by subtracting the current low from the previous low. This endpoint is part of a financial data API that provides real-time and historical data on stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, indices, and more, enabling developers to analyze market trends and make informed decisions. Access the documentation here: [documentation](https://twelvedata.com/docs) and start [here](https://twelvedata.com/apikey).

Calculates the true trading range of an asset to determine its normal volatility, serving as a foundational metric for technical analysis. This is part of the financial data platform that provides real-time and historical data across stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, and indices, enabling developers to build tools that leverage precise volatility measurements for informed trading decisions.

Calculates Kaufman's Adaptive Moving Average (KAMA) to adapt to market volatility and noise, providing traders with dynamic trend-following insights. This endpoint leverages the parent tool's financial data infrastructure, which offers real-time and historical data across stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, and indices, enabling developers to integrate adaptive technical analysis into trading strategies with precision.

Returns the best order price across all cryptocurrency symbols when no specific symbol is provided. This endpoint leverages Bybit's public data infrastructure, which offers real-time cryptocurrency prices, charts, and market data for derivatives, futures, spot trading, and USDC contracts, enabling users to access aggregated market depth information efficiently.

query: I'm trying to get a comprehensive picture of market sentiment right now. Could you analyze what people are saying about Apple and Tesla, check what influential voices like Howard Lindzon and Jim Cramer are posting, and also gather insights from my personal watchlists and the people I follow? I'm particularly interested in comparing the expert opinions with broader community sentiment.

task_description: This task assesses the overall mood or sentiment surrounding a particular stock by combining quantitative analysis of news media with real-time data from social platforms dedicated to trading and investing.

query: I'm trying to gauge market sentiment for tech stocks - could you analyze what people are saying about Apple, Tesla, NVIDIA, and Google, and compare that with overall market chatter? Also, I'd like to see what my followed accounts and professional investor relations teams are discussing, particularly what StockTwits official account and Howard Lindzon are posting about. And please confirm my account is properly connected before pulling all this data.

tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Get Exchange Details
tool_list.tool description:
With this API endpoint you will get detailed information about each exchange we do support, including:

- Timezone – the timezone of exchange
- isOpen – boolean value which indicates if exchange open right now or closed.
- Trading hours and working days – open hours with working days for each exchange in the exchange timezone. This field could include also lunch hours if the exchange has it.
- ActiveTickers – tickers with any activity for the past two months.
- UpdatedTickers – tickers updated for the current day.

Get the list of the top gaining or losing mutual funds today.

Top gainers are ordered by the highest rate of price increase since the previous day's close. Top losers are ordered by the highest percentage of price decrease since the last day.

Availability: Ultra plan
Data weighting: 100 API credits per symbol

tool_list.tool description: Calculates the Average Directional Movement Index Rating (ADXR), a smoothed version of the ADX indicator, to quantify momentum changes in financial markets. This endpoint leverages the parent tool's financial data infrastructure, which provides real-time and historical data across stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, and indices, to deliver accurate ADXR values for technical analysis. By utilizing advanced algorithmic processing of market data, ADXR helps traders identify trend strength and potential reversals, offering actionable insights for informed decision-making.

Calculates the dominant cycle phase using Hilbert Transform techniques to analyze financial market cycles. This endpoint leverages the parent tool's financial data infrastructure, which provides real-time and historical data across stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, and indices, enabling developers to identify cyclical patterns in market behavior. tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Fundamental Data API
tool_list.tool description:
Simple access to fundamental data API for stocks, ETFs, Mutual Funds, and Indices from different exchanges and countries. Almost all major US, UK, EU, India, and Asia exchanges.

Stocks, ETFs, Mutual Funds fundamental data

Major US companies supported from 1985, more than 30 years and non-US symbols supported from 2000, it’s more than 21 years of the financial data. Symbols from major US exchanges (around 11000 tickers in total from NYSE, NASDAQ, and ARCA) 20 years both yearly and quarterly. For minor companies, we have data for the last 6 years and the previous 20 quarters. And the data is continually growing.
We support more than 20.000 US Funds. Our database has equity funds as well as balanced and bond-based mutual funds.
We also support details for more than 10,000 ETFs from different exchanges and countries.
We provide Index Constituents (or Index Components) data for all major indices all around the world.
Please note, not all companies report the whole financial data, then we can not guarantee that each company will have all data endpoints we do support.
Due to a very complex data structure, we support fundamental data feeds only in JSON format.

Returns the amount of the company’s available stock owned by institutions (pension funds, insurance companies, investment firms, private foundations, endowments, or other large entities that manage funds on behalf of others).

tool_list.tool name: EOD Historical Data: Macroeconomics Data and Macro Indicators API
tool_list.tool description:
Macroeconomics is a part of economics dealing with the performance, structure, behavior, and decision-making of an economy as a whole. Our Macroeconomics Data API includes regional, national, and global economies. We provide the data for more than 30 macro indicators such as GDP, unemployment rates, national income, price indices, inflation rates, consumption, international trades, and many other significant indicators.

The Macroeconomics Data API is a part of Fundamental API and accessible under Fundamental subscription. Each Macroeconomics API request consumes 1 API call. To get macroeconomics indicators use the following URL:

> https://eodhistoricaldata.com/api/macro-indicator/COUNTRY?api_token=YOUR_API_TOKEN&fmt=json&indicator=inflation_consumer_prices_annual

**COUNTRY**: String. REQUIRED. Defines the country for which the indicator will be shown. The country should be defined in the Alpha-3 ISO format. Possible values: USA, FRA, DEU…
**api_ token**: String. REQUIRED. Your api_token to access the API. You will get it after registration.
**indicator**: String. OPTIONAL. Defines which macroeconomics data indicator will be shown. See the list of possible indicators below. The default value is ‘gdp_current_usd‘.
**fmt**: String. OPTIONAL. The output format could be ‘json’ for JSON and ‘csv’ for CSV output. The default value is ‘json’.

We provide the data for more than 30 macro indicators such as GDP, unemployment rates, national income, price indices, inflation rates, consumption, international trades, and many other significant indicators.

The Macroeconomics Data API is a part of Fundamental API and accessible under Fundamental subscription. Each Macroeconomics API request consumes 1 API call. To get macroeconomics indicators use the following URL:

> https://eodhistoricaldata.com/api/macro-indicator/COUNTRY?api_token=YOUR_API_TOKEN&fmt=json&indicator=inflation_consumer_prices_annual

**COUNTRY**: String. REQUIRED. Defines the country for which the indicator will be shown. The country should be defined in the Alpha-3 ISO format. Possible values: USA, FRA, DEU…
**api_ token**: String. REQUIRED. Your api_token to access the API. You will get it after registration.
**indicator**: String. OPTIONAL. Defines which macroeconomics data indicator will be shown. See the list of possible indicators below. The default value is ‘gdp_current_usd‘.
**fmt**: String. OPTIONAL. The output format could be ‘json’ for JSON and ‘csv’ for CSV output. The default value is ‘json’.

This endpoint leverages the parent tool's financial data infrastructure, which provides real-time and historical data across stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, and indices, to deliver accurate ADXR values for technical analysis. By utilizing advanced algorithmic processing of market data, ADXR helps traders identify trend strength and potential reversals, offering actionable insights for informed decision-making.
